channel.description: Asynchronous JavaScript and XML (AJAX) is a term coined by Jesse James Garrett to describe a technique of using the XMLHttpRequest object to request resources directly from JavaScript. As the name implies, this was originally used to request XML content, but the technique can be used with any kind of data. The XMLHttpRequest The XMLHttpRequest object is modeled after how the window object makes web requests.
